comments:
I am using Java awt components and while calling a dialog from frame, following 
error is shown while debugging through eclips.

Error: Error : JDI thread evaluation. Error exception processing async thread.
and keylisteners does not work for various components used in the Dialog. 
However rest of the listeners work.

Here is the code for reference.

//Code that gives error
ScreenSymptom sc = new ScreenSymptom(new Frame());
sc.show();

ScreenSymptom extends Dialog and it is called from a class which extends Frame.

Thanks.
Can you attach you .log file with the trace of the associated exception?

Here is the error log.


!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 120 Nov 17, 2004 07:28:24.109
!MESSAGE Exception processing async thread queue
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 120 Nov 17, 2004 07:28:24.109
!MESSAGE Exception processing async thread queue
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.instructions.PushArrayLength.execute
(PushArrayLength.java:27)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.Interpreter.execute
(Interpreter.java:50)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.ASTEvaluationEngine$1
$EvaluationRunnable.run(ASTEvaluationEngine.java:317)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread.runEvaluation
(JDIThread.java:659)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.ASTEvaluationEngine$EvalRunnable.
run(ASTEvaluationEngine.java:351)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread$ThreadJob.run
(JDIThread.java:2516)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

The trace shows that you are performing an evaluation. Do you have any watch
expressions or detail formatters defined ?

Yes. I do have some watch expressions.However there is no watch on the 
variables that are passed to the Dialog screen.

I removed all the Watch expressions and now the error is gone. 
Can you please explain me the reason so that I can take care of it next time.

Thanks for your help.

The watch expressions are evaluated every time the VM suspends. The watch
expressions can be complex snippets of code, the only way to know if we can
evaluate it the current context, is to try it.

In your case, the evaluation of one watch expression in a specific context
triggers a problem is the evaluation engine.
That would be great if we can solve this problem.
Do you remember what were the watch expression ? The interresting one would be
one that access the lenght attribute of an array (could be an 1.5 enhanced
for-loop on an array too).
Can you try to reproduce the problem ? and send me the information you have, so
I can try to reproduce the problem.

Hi,

I tried to re-produce the problem But I can't. I tried adding all the 
expressions I can remember. 

In case this error message comes again, I will definately post it. 

Thanks for your explanation.

Ok, thanks.
Closing this bug for now.
Please reopen if you can reproduce it.
